p: The SNPs prioritised by ML (Tables 1 and 2) showed significant enrichment in microglial (p = 0.0024) and astrocytic regions (p = 0.0083), but not synaptic regions (p = 0.117). All 68 genes from 52 loci reported in Tables 1 and 2 were further analysed for protein-protein interaction scores using the online tool STRING (Supplementary Fig. 10). Pathway analyses demonstrated enrichment in various gene-ontology (GO) pathways (Fig. 3d, Supplementary Data 7). As expected, GO pathways yielded a number of biological processes of interest to Alzheimer’s disease, including regulation of amyloid beta formation (pFDR = 0.0014) and regulation of amyloid precursor protein catabolic process (pFDR = 0.00023, Fig. 3d).
